How to Install gtk2-engines-moblin on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • gtk2-engines-moblin

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install gtk2-engines-moblin on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing gtk2-engines-moblin on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall gtk2-engines-moblin in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install gtk2-engines-moblin, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install gtk2-engines-moblin Using apt

To install gtk2-engines-moblin in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install gtk2-engines-moblin using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install gtk2-engines-moblin

The installation of gtk2-engines-moblin might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install gtk2-engines-moblin Using apt-get

To install gtk2-engines-moblin using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install gtk2-engines-moblin.

sudo apt-get -y install gtk2-engines-moblin

Install gtk2-engines-moblin Using Synaptic

To install gtk2-engines-moblin using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install gtk2-engines-moblin on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for gtk2-engines-moblin. This will display the gtk2-engines-moblin package in the package window, now to install gtk2-engines-moblin, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the gtk2-engines-moblin package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of gtk2-engines-moblin.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install gtk2-engines-moblin Using aptitude

To install gtk2-engines-moblin on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of gtk2-engines-moblin.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install gtk2-engines-moblin using the command aptitude install gtk2-engines-moblin.

sudo aptitude -y install gtk2-engines-moblin

How to Upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin on debian

If you want to upgrade the gtk2-engines-moblin package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin

Upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin using Aptitude

To upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin

Upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin using Synaptic

To upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for gtk2-engines-moblin, now right-click gtk2-engines-moblin, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall gtk2-engines-moblin on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall gtk2-engines-moblin from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just gtk2-engines-moblin, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove gtk2-engines-moblin

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of gtk2-engines-moblin

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of gtk2-engines-moblin you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge gtk2-engines-moblin

Remove gtk2-engines-moblin using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall gtk2-engines-moblin using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for gtk2-engines-moblin, right-click the gtk2-engines-moblin package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall gtk2-engines-moblin click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install gtk2-engines-moblin on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade gtk2-engines-moblin using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of gtk2-engines-moblin then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
